tags.name: Agents
tags.description: An agent is an LLM-powered actor that can be invoked on a thread.

tags.name: Threads
tags.description:
A thread contains the accumulated outputs of a group of runs. It is a container to maintain the state of an agent across multiple runs. It also acts as a registry for the runs.

A thread keeps track of agent states at every step so that continuity of the context is preserved. Moreover, such a book-keeping enables us some granular controls like debugging, interrupting or replaying a run/invocation.

A thread state is a data context defined by the developer and can be anything (e.g. a `typeddict`) and it gets passed through from one invocation to another so that business logic is instrumented by data.

A thread keeps track of the whole state history. At every step, it also applies a checkpoint, which is primarily a `uuid`, so that it is easier to refer to a chunk of the history.

One can easily query the last state, a specific state (by checkpoint id), the whole state history, or, a part of the history (from a checkpoint).

See `Thread`, `ThreadState` and `Checkpoint` models below for more info.

tags.name: Runs
tags.description: A run is an invocation of an agent on a thread. It updates the state of the thread.

tags.name: Stateless Runs
tags.description: A run is an invocation of an agent, with no state or memory persistence.

tags.name: Store
tags.description: Store is an API for managing persistent key-value store (long-term memory) that is available from any thread.

post.description: List Agents available in this service.

name.description: Name of the agent to search.

metadata.description: Metadata of the agent to search.

get.description: Get an agent's schemas by ID.

post.description:
Search for threads.

This endpoint also functions as the endpoint to list all threads.

schema.title: Response Search Threads Threads Search Post

get.description: Get all past states for a thread.

post.description: Create a new thread with a copy of the state and checkpoints from an existing thread.
Create a run in existing thread, return the run ID immediately. Don't wait for the final run output.
Create a run in existing thread. Stream the output.
Create a run in existing thread. Wait for the final output and then return it.

get.description: Wait for a run to finish, return the final output. If the run already finished, returns its final output immediately.

Join the output stream of an existing run. This endpoint streams output in real-time from a run similar to the /threads/__THREAD_ID__/runs/stream endpoint. Only output produced after this endpoint is called will be streamed.

parameters.description: Action to take when cancelling the run. Possible values are `interrupt` or `rollback`. `interrupt` will simply cancel the run. `rollback` will cancel the run and delete the run and associated checkpoints afterwards.
parameters.name: action

post.description: Create a run in a new thread, return the run ID immediately. Don't wait for the final run output.
Create a run in a new thread, stream the output.

schema.description:
The server will send a stream of events in SSE format.

**Example event**:

id: 1

event: message

data: {}

post.description: Create a run in a new thread. Wait for the final output and then return it.

post.summary: Search for items within a namespace prefix.
List namespaces with optional match conditions.

input_schema.title: Input Schema
input_schema.description: The schema for the agent input. In JSON Schema format.

output_schema.title: Output Schema
output_schema.description: The schema for the agent output. In JSON Schema format.

state_schema.title: State Schema
state_schema.description: The schema for the agent's internal state. In JSON Schema format.

config_schema.title: Config Schema
config_schema.description: The schema for the agent config. In JSON Schema format.

AgentSchemas.title: AgentSchemas
AgentSchemas.description: Defines the structure and properties of an agent.

agent_id.title: Agent Id
agent_id.description: The agent that was used for this run.

created_at.title: Created At
created_at.description: The time the run was created.

updated_at.title: Updated At
updated_at.description: The last time the run was updated.

status.title: Status
status.description: The status of the run. One of 'pending', 'error', 'success', 'timeout', 'interrupted'.

multitask_strategy.title: Multitask Strategy
multitask_strategy.description: Strategy to handle concurrent runs on the same thread.

agent_id.title: Agent Id
agent_id.description: The agent ID to run. If not provided will use the default agent for this service.

metadata.title: Metadata
metadata.description: Metadata to assign to the run.

webhook.title: Webhook
webhook.description: Webhook to call after run finishes.

stream_subgraphs.title: Stream Subgraphs
stream_subgraphs.description: Whether to stream output from subgraphs.

on_disconnect.title: On Disconnect
on_disconnect.description: The disconnect mode to use. Must be one of 'cancel' or 'continue'.

multitask_strategy.title: Multitask Strategy
multitask_strategy.description: Multitask strategy to use. Must be one of 'reject', 'interrupt', 'rollback', or 'enqueue'.

if_not_exists.title: If Not Exists
if_not_exists.description: How to handle missing thread. Must be either 'reject' (raise error if missing), or 'create' (create new thread).

after_seconds.title: After Seconds
after_seconds.description: The number of seconds to wait before starting the run. Use to schedule future runs.

agent_id.title: Agent Id
agent_id.description: The agent ID to run. If not provided will use the default agent for this service.

metadata.title: Metadata
metadata.description: Metadata to assign to the run.

webhook.title: Webhook
webhook.description: Webhook to call after run finishes.

on_completion.title: On Completion
on_completion.description: Whether to delete or keep the thread created for a stateless run. Must be one of 'delete' or 'keep'.

on_disconnect.title: On Disconnect
on_disconnect.description: The disconnect mode to use. Must be one of 'cancel' or 'continue'.

multitask_strategy.title: Multitask Strategy
multitask_strategy.description: Multitask strategy to use. Must be one of 'reject', 'interrupt', 'rollback', or 'enqueue'.

after_seconds.title: After Seconds
after_seconds.description: The number of seconds to wait before starting the run. Use to schedule future runs.

created_at.title: Created At
created_at.description: The time the thread was created.

updated_at.title: Updated At
updated_at.description: The last time the thread was updated.

values.title: Values
values.description: The current state of the thread.

messages.title: Messages
messages.description: The current Messages of the thread. If messages are contained in Thread.values, implementations should remove them from values when returning messages. When this key isn't present it means the thread/agent doesn't support messages.

ThreadCheckpoint.title: ThreadCheckpoint
ThreadCheckpoint.description: Structured identifier for a thread checkpoint, ie. an entry in the thread's history.

values.title: Values
values.description: The current state of the thread.

messages.title: Messages
messages.description: The current messages of the thread. If messages are contained in Thread.values, implementations should remove them from values when returning messages. When this key isn't present it means the thread/agent doesn't support messages.

thread_id.title: Thread Id
thread_id.description: The ID of the thread. If not provided, a random UUID will be generated.

if_exists.title: If Exists
if_exists.description: How to handle duplicate creation. Must be either 'raise' (raise error if duplicate), or 'do_nothing' (return existing thread).

checkpoint.title: Checkpoint
checkpoint.description: The identifier of the checkpoint to branch from. Ignored for metadata-only patches. If not provided, defaults to the latest checkpoint.

metadata.title: Metadata
metadata.description: Metadata to merge with existing thread metadata.

values.title: Values
values.description: Values to merge with existing thread values.

messages.title: Messages
messages.description: The current Messages of the thread. If messages are contained in Thread.values, implementations should remove them from values when returning messages. When this key isn't present it means the thread/agent doesn't support messages.

namespace.title: Namespace
namespace.description: A list of strings representing the namespace path.

key.title: Key
key.description: The unique identifier for the item within the namespace.

value.title: Value
value.description: A dictionary containing the item's data.

StorePutRequest.title: StorePutRequest
StorePutRequest.description: Request to store or update an item.

namespace.title: Namespace
namespace.description: A list of strings representing the namespace path.

key.title: Key
key.description: The unique identifier for the item.

namespace_prefix.title: Namespace Prefix
namespace_prefix.description: List of strings representing the namespace prefix.

filter.title: Filter
filter.description: Optional dictionary of key-value pairs to filter results.

limit.title: Limit
limit.description: Maximum number of items to return (default is 10).

offset.title: Offset
offset.description: Number of items to skip before returning results (default is 0).

StoreSearchRequest.title: StoreSearchRequest
StoreSearchRequest.description: Request to search for items within a namespace prefix.

prefix.title: Prefix
prefix.description: Optional list of strings representing the prefix to filter namespaces.

suffix.title: Suffix
suffix.description: Optional list of strings representing the suffix to filter namespaces.

max_depth.title: Max Depth
max_depth.description: Optional integer specifying the maximum depth of namespaces to return.

limit.title: Limit
limit.description: Maximum number of namespaces to return (default is 100).

offset.title: Offset
offset.description: Number of namespaces to skip before returning results (default is 0).

namespace.description: The namespace of the item. A namespace is analogous to a document's directory.

key.description: The unique identifier of the item within its namespace. In general, keys needn't be globally unique.

value.description: The value stored in the item. This is the document itself.

created_at.description: The timestamp when the item was created.

updated_at.description: The timestamp when the item was last updated.

Item.description: Represents a single document or data entry in the graph's Store. Items are used to store cross-thread memories.

ErrorResponse.title: ErrorResponse
ErrorResponse.description: Error message returned from the server
